title: How to Make a Candy Filled Pinata Cake

steps.headline: Choose the cake mixes.
steps.description: For the best results, choose the same two flavors or flavors that match with each other, such as vanilla and chocolate or yellow and strawberry.

steps.headline: Use the box instructions to prepare the cakes.
steps.description: Bake the cakes in round pans, rather than square or rectangular pans. The deeper the pans are, the better results of the "pinata" you will have.

steps.headline: Cool the cakes completely.
steps.description: If you have any chocolate or candies that can easily melt, you don't want them to melt inside a warm or hot cake.

steps.headline: Hollow the cakes.
steps.description: Treat the cakes like as if you are carving pumpkins. Indent into the cakes with a knife, about 2 to 3 inches (5 to 7.5 cm) from the edges. Slice into the cakes, leaving a 2 to 3 inch (5 to 7.5 cm) height from the bottoms. Carve out the middle. Use the leftover cake for a side treat, such as cake pops!

steps.headline: Frost the cakes.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to spread frosting on the sides and halved edges.

steps.headline: Fill the insides of one cake.
steps.description: Add your candies in the middle of one carved cake.

steps.headline: Top the filled cake with the other carved cake.
steps.description: Flip the top cake over so both hollowed parts meet. Align the sides so they are evenly matched.

steps.headline: Frost the cake.
steps.description: Finish frosting the top and sides with a spatula so it is evenly smooth.

text: Baking the Cake Choose the cake mixes. For the best results, choose the same two flavors or flavors that match with each other, such as vanilla and chocolate or yellow and strawberry. Use the box instructions to prepare the cakes. Bake the cakes in round pans, rather than square or rectangular pans. The deeper the pans are, the better results of the "pinata" you will have. Cool the cakes completely. If you have any chocolate or candies that can easily melt, you don't want them to melt inside a warm or hot cake. Filling the Cake Hollow the cakes. Treat the cakes like as if you are carving pumpkins. Indent into the cakes with a knife, about 2 to 3 inches (5 to 7.5 cm) from the edges. Slice into the cakes, leaving a 2 to 3 inch (5 to 7.5 cm) height from the bottoms. Carve out the middle. Use the leftover cake for a side treat, such as cake pops! Frost the cakes. Use a rubber spatula to spread frosting on the sides and halved edges. Fill the insides of one cake. Add your candies in the middle of one carved cake. Finishing the Cake Top the filled cake with the other carved cake. Flip the top cake over so both hollowed parts meet. Align the sides so they are evenly matched. Frost the cake. Finish frosting the top and sides with a spatula so it is evenly smooth. Add decorations. Sprinkle additional candy on top. Finished.
